intro: Mattiastrum lithospermifolium subsp. lithospermifolium, commonly known as the stone root plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky soils. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts used traditionally in local remedies.
